newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Vnukovo Airlines H1 passenger traffic down.
newsitem.headline: Vnukovo Airlines H1 passenger traffic down.

text.p: Russia's biggest domestic air carrier Vnukovo Airlines carried 812,000 passengers in the first half of this year, compared with 860,000 passengers during the same period last year, a senior company official said on Friday.
Sergei Komasko, chief sales manager, said the airline carried 6,990 tonnes of mail and freight during the first six months. Between January and June of 1995 it carried 7,463 tonnes, he added.

Moscow-based Vnukovo Airlines was set up in 1993 after former Soviet monopolist Aeroflot was split. Currently, the company operates 54 aircraft making regular flights to 27 domestic destinations and operates 10 international charters.
In 1995 Vnukovo Airlines carried 1.9 million passengers and 15,300 tonnes of cargo and mail.
